snippet: Prosecutors have appealed a judge's decision that overturned the murder conviction of Elmer (Geronimo) Pratt, a former leader of the Black Panther Party in Southern California, claiming that prior evidence of his guilt is ''overwhelming.''    The ...
lead_paragraph: Prosecutors have appealed a judge's decision that overturned the murder conviction of Elmer (Geronimo) Pratt, a former leader of the Black Panther Party in Southern California, claiming that prior evidence of his guilt is ''overwhelming.'' The prosecutors' appeal, which had been expected, was filed on Friday in the Second District Court of Appeal here.
abstract: Prosecutors in California appeal court ruling overturning murder conviction of Elmer Pratt, former leader of Black Panther Party, on grounds that evidence of his guilt is 'overwhelming'; Pratt served 27 years in prison for killing 27-year-old teacher, Caroline Olsen, during 1968 robbery, crime he claims he did not commit (S)
